intro: Dorycnium kotschyi, commonly known as the Persian hogweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance and produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Dorycnium kotschyi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
